dialog.speaker: Patient
dialog.spanish: Doctora, ¿todo va bien con mi embarazo?
dialog.english: Doctor, is everything going well with my pregnancy?

dialog.speaker: Doctora
dialog.spanish: Sí, todo se ve perfecto. El bebé está creciendo muy bien.
dialog.english: Yes, everything looks perfect. The baby is growing very well.

dialog.speaker: Patient
dialog.spanish: Ya puedo sentir sus movimientos. Es increíble.
dialog.english: I can already feel its movements. It's incredible.

dialog.speaker: Doctora
dialog.spanish: Eso es una buena señal. Es muy activo.
dialog.english: That's a good sign. It's very active.

dialog.speaker: Patient
dialog.spanish: ¿Cuándo es mi próxima ecografía?
dialog.english: When is my next ultrasound?

dialog.speaker: Doctora
dialog.spanish: La próxima cita será en cuatro semanas.
dialog.english: The next appointment will be in four weeks.

questions.question: ¿Qué le pregunta la paciente a la doctora?
options: Si el bebé es niño o niña

dialog.speaker: Padre
dialog.spanish: Hola, doctor. Nuestro bebé no para de llorar.
dialog.english: Hello, doctor. Our baby won't stop crying.

dialog.speaker: Pediatra
dialog.spanish: Es normal, los bebés lloran para comunicarse. ¿Cuándo le dieron de comer la última vez?
dialog.english: It's normal, babies cry to communicate. When did you feed him last?

dialog.speaker: Madre
dialog.spanish: Hace una hora. Le dimos leche de fórmula en el biberón.
dialog.english: An hour ago. We gave him formula milk in the bottle.

dialog.speaker: Pediatra
dialog.spanish: Puede ser el pañal. Vamos a revisarlo.
dialog.english: It might be the diaper. Let's check it.

dialog.speaker: Madre
dialog.spanish: Gracias, estamos un poco nerviosos.
dialog.english: Thank you, we're a little nervous.

dialog.speaker: Pediatra
dialog.spanish: Es natural. Tranquilos, todo está bien con el bebé.
dialog.english: It's natural. Don't worry, everything is fine with the baby.

questions.question: ¿Qué usaron los padres para alimentar al bebé?

dialog.speaker: Pediatra
dialog.spanish: Hola, Sra. López. ¿Cómo está el bebé hoy?
dialog.english: Hello, Mrs. Lopez. How is the baby today?

dialog.speaker: Patient
dialog.spanish: Está bien, doctor. Solo queremos asegurarnos de que todo va bien con su desarrollo.
dialog.english: He's fine, doctor. We just want to make sure everything is going well with his development.

dialog.speaker: Pediatra
dialog.spanish: Perfecto. Vamos a pesar y medir al bebé.
dialog.english: Perfect. Let's weigh and measure the baby.

dialog.speaker: Patient
dialog.spanish: Ha estado comiendo muy bien últimamente.
dialog.english: He's been eating very well lately.

dialog.speaker: Pediatra
dialog.spanish: Sí, su peso es excelente. ¿Alguna preocupación sobre su sueño o alimentación?
dialog.english: Yes, his weight is excellent. Any concerns about his sleep or feeding?

dialog.speaker: Patient
dialog.spanish: A veces le dan cólicos, pero el chupete lo calma.
dialog.english: Sometimes he gets colic, but the pacifier calms him.

questions.question: ¿Qué van a hacer con el bebé?
¿Qué calma al bebé cuando tiene cólicos?

dialog.speaker: Madre
dialog.spanish: Doctor, mi bebé tiene tres meses y ya sonríe mucho.
dialog.english: Doctor, my baby is three months old and smiles a lot already.

dialog.speaker: Pediatra
dialog.spanish: Es un gran avance. ¿Ya sostiene la cabeza?
dialog.english: That's a great milestone. Does he hold his head up yet?

dialog.speaker: Padre
dialog.spanish: Sí, y le encantan sus juguetes. Empezamos a pensar en la guardería.
dialog.english: Yes, and he loves his toys. We're starting to think about daycare.

dialog.speaker: Pediatra
dialog.spanish: Es una buena idea. Recuerden la importancia de las vacunas en esta etapa.
dialog.english: That's a good idea. Remember the importance of vaccines at this stage.

dialog.speaker: Madre
dialog.spanish: Lo tenemos en mente. ¿Cuándo debemos empezar con la papilla?
dialog.english: We're keeping that in mind. When should we start with baby food?

dialog.speaker: Pediatra
dialog.spanish: Normalmente, a los seis meses. Hablaremos de eso en la próxima consulta.
dialog.english: Normally, at six months. We'll talk about that at the next consultation.

questions.question: ¿Qué les recuerda el pediatra a los padres?

sentences.spanish: Sofía y su esposo, Mateo, esperaban con nervios los resultados de la prueba.
sentences.english: Sofía and her husband, Mateo, were nervously waiting for the test results.

sentences.spanish: Cuando Sofía vio el resultado positivo, no pudo contener las lágrimas.
sentences.english: When Sofía saw the positive result, she couldn't hold back the tears.

sentences.spanish: —¡Mateo, vamos a tener un bebé!
sentences.english: —Mateo, we're going to have a baby!

sentences.spanish: Mateo la abrazó con fuerza. Estaban llenos de alegría.
sentences.english: Mateo hugged her tightly. They were filled with joy.

sentences.spanish: A partir de ese día, Sofía empezó a sentir los primeros síntomas del embarazo.
sentences.english: From that day on, Sofía began to feel the first symptoms of pregnancy.

sentences.spanish: Tenía náuseas matutinas y un antojo de helado de fresa.
sentences.english: She had morning sickness and a craving for strawberry ice cream.

sentences.spanish: Compraron un libro sobre cómo cuidar a su futuro bebé y no podían esperar para empezar el viaje.
sentences.english: They bought a book about how to care for their future baby and couldn't wait to start the journey.

sentences.spanish: Las primeras contracciones de Ana empezaron a las dos de la mañana.
sentences.english: Ana's first contractions started at two in the morning.

sentences.spanish: Su esposo, Pablo, la llevó al hospital inmediatamente.
sentences.english: Her husband, Pablo, took her to the hospital immediately.

sentences.spanish: Después de varias horas, una enfermera les dijo que el parto ya estaba cerca.
sentences.english: After several hours, a nurse told them that childbirth was now close.

sentences.spanish: Finalmente, un llanto llenó la habitación. Había nacido su bebé.
sentences.english: Finally, a cry filled the room. Their baby had been born.

sentences.spanish: Ana estaba cansada, pero su felicidad era inmensa.
sentences.english: Ana was tired, but her happiness was immense.

sentences.spanish: Pablo no podía dejar de mirar a su pequeña hija, con una sonrisa de oreja a oreja.
sentences.english: Pablo couldn't stop looking at his little daughter, with a smile from ear to ear.

sentences.spanish: Laura y Carlos tenían un recién nacido, Daniel.
sentences.english: Laura and Carlos had a newborn, Daniel.

sentences.spanish: La primera semana en casa fue un desafío, especialmente las noches.
sentences.english: The first week at home was a challenge, especially the nights.

sentences.spanish: Daniel lloraba mucho y no parecía querer dormir en su cuna.
sentences.english: Daniel cried a lot and didn't seem to want to sleep in his crib.

sentences.spanish: Laura intentó darle el biberón y cambiarle el pañal, pero el llanto continuaba.
sentences.english: Laura tried to give him the bottle and change his diaper, but the crying continued.

sentences.spanish: Carlos sugirió que tal vez tenía cólicos. Recordaron la consulta con el pediatra.
sentences.english: Carlos suggested that maybe he had colic. They remembered the pediatrician's consultation.

sentences.spanish: Después de mecerlo y cantarle por un rato, Daniel finalmente se durmió.
sentences.english: After rocking and singing to him for a while, Daniel finally fell asleep.

sentences.spanish: Laura y Carlos se miraron, agotados pero felices. Ser padres era una aventura.
sentences.english: Laura and Carlos looked at each other, exhausted but happy. Being parents was an adventure.

sentences.spanish: María y David estaban en la sala de espera de la clínica de ginecología.
sentences.english: Maria and David were in the waiting room of the gynecology clinic.

sentences.spanish: Era su primera ecografía y ambos estaban muy emocionados.
sentences.english: It was their first ultrasound and both were very excited.

sentences.spanish: El doctor los llamó y los guió a la sala de examen.
sentences.english: The doctor called them and guided them to the examination room.

sentences.spanish: En la pantalla, pudieron ver una pequeña forma.
sentences.english: On the screen, they could see a tiny shape.

sentences.spanish: —Ahí está su feto. Todo se ve muy bien en este primer trimestre.
sentences.english: —There's your fetus. Everything looks very good in this first trimester.

sentences.spanish: dijo el doctor con una sonrisa.
sentences.english: said the doctor with a smile.

sentences.spanish: María no pudo evitar las lágrimas de alegría al ver a su futuro bebé.
sentences.english: Maria couldn't help but cry tears of joy seeing her future baby.

sentences.spanish: David tomó su mano, sintiendo la misma emoción. Este era el comienzo de algo maravilloso.
sentences.english: David took her hand, feeling the same emotion. This was the beginning of something wonderful.

speaking.title: Hablando de Embarazo
speaking.description: Preguntas y respuestas para conversar sobre el embarazo y los primeros años de un bebé.

answer.spanish: Significa 'to be pregnant'.
answer.english: It means 'to be pregnant'.

answer.spanish: Es un examen para ver al bebé en el vientre.
answer.english: It's an exam to see the baby in the womb.

answer.spanish: Son los síntomas de malestar que tienen las mujeres embarazadas.
answer.english: They are symptoms of discomfort that pregnant women have.

answer.spanish: Es cuando una persona quiere comer algo en particular, como chocolate.
answer.english: It's when a person wants to eat something in particular, like chocolate.

question.english: What does it feel like to have contractions?

answer.spanish: Las contracciones son dolores fuertes que ocurren antes del parto.
answer.english: Contractions are strong pains that happen before childbirth.

answer.spanish: Es un doctor que cuida a los niños.
answer.english: It's a doctor who takes care of children.

answer.spanish: Se usan para los bebés cuando van al baño.
answer.english: They are used for babies when they go to the bathroom.

answer.spanish: Significa 'to be born'.
answer.english: It means 'to be born'.

question.spanish: ¿Cómo se alimenta a un bebé con un biberón?
question.english: How do you feed a baby with a bottle?

answer.spanish: Se llena el biberón con leche o fórmula y se le da al bebé.
answer.english: You fill the bottle with milk or formula and give it to the baby.

answer.spanish: La cuna es la cama del bebé.
answer.english: The crib is the baby's bed.

answer.spanish: Son inyecciones para proteger a los bebés de enfermedades.
answer.english: They are injections to protect babies from illnesses.

question.spanish: ¿Cómo se llama el doctor de mujeres embarazadas?
question.english: What is the name of the doctor for pregnant women?

answer.spanish: Se llama ginecólogo o ginecóloga.
answer.english: It is called a gynecologist.

answer.spanish: Lloran para comunicarse o porque tienen hambre.
answer.english: They cry to communicate or because they are hungry.

question.spanish: ¿Cuándo se puede sentir el movimiento del feto?
question.english: When can you feel the fetus's movement?

answer.spanish: Generalmente, en el segundo o tercer trimestre.
answer.english: Generally, in the second or third trimester.

answer.spanish: Es la fecha en que el bebé va a nacer.
answer.english: It's the date the baby will be born.

answer.spanish: Significa 'breastfeeding'.
answer.english: It means 'breastfeeding'.

answer.spanish: Es un bebé que acaba de nacer.
answer.english: It's a baby who has just been born.

question.spanish: ¿Qué hacen los padres con el llanto del bebé?
question.english: What do parents do with the baby's crying?

answer.spanish: Lo calman, le dan de comer, o cambian el pañal.
answer.english: They calm him, feed him, or change his diaper.

question.spanish: ¿Cuál es la diferencia entre un bebé y un feto?
question.english: What is the difference between a baby and a fetus?

answer.spanish: Un feto está en el vientre y un bebé ya ha nacido.
answer.english: A fetus is in the womb and a baby has already been born.

answer.spanish: Es comida suave para bebés pequeños.
answer.english: It's soft food for small babies.
